intro: Psilocaulon granulicaule, commonly known as the granulate psilocaulon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces fleshy, berry-like fruits. Psilocaulon granulicaule is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
